result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin A. Rochon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Must be employed 35 hours a week and if unemployed diligent job search.
No consumption or possession of alcohol.
May not enter any bars or taverns.
Must stay current on child support.
Must provide DNA if not provided, no surcharge.

timeConds.notes:
Stayed if the following conditions complied with:  
Must keep child support advised of current employment and address within 48 hours.
Must remain full time employment.
Must remain current on support. 
Must file taxes by April 15 every year, by April 30th a copy to be filed with the child support office.
Hueber granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kevin A. Rochon in court with attorney Henry Francis Mcroberts.  Douglas J. Drexler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.   Count 1 plea of no contest.  Count 2 dismissed but read in.    Plea is freely, voluntarily, and intelligently given.    Constitutional rights read and waived.  Statement by Attorney Drexler.  Statement by Attorney McRoberts.  Statement by Kevin Rochon.  Court Sentences:  3 years probation sentence withheld.  60 days in Florence County Jail stayed; following conditions must be complied with:  Must keep child support advised of current employment and address within 48 hours; Must remain full time employment; Must remain current on support; Must file taxes by April 15 every year, by April 30th a copy to be filed with the child support office.  Conditions:    Must be employed 35 hours a week and if unemployed diligent job search; No consumption or possession of alcohol; may not enter any bars or taverns; must stay current.  Costs.  Must provide DNA if not provided, no surcharge.  Felon stats given.  Arg.  tln
Plea of not guilty.  Bond continued.  tln

Defendant Kevin A. Rochon in court with attorney Henry Francis Mcroberts.  Douglas J. Drexler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Waive reading of complaint.  tln  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.
